title: Why my pixel 3xl having issue when playing dark scene video, looks like broken pixel
content:
Is it normal for dark scenes to looks bad on the Pixel 3 XL's AMOLED screen?
Greetings,
 
Looking to find out if the following is normal of all screens or if it is a specific defect on my unit:
 
-Watching the intro to the movie Arrival, the camera is I think panning along the ceiling and it starts off dark (pitch black); the transition on my screen looks terrible; even though I am supposed to be seeing a uniform black (at least initially I think) I see like large patches of distinct grades of black on the screen that move all over the place. Sorry, I don't know what to call them (patches, smudges, like large pixelated pacmans?). I didn't even know what I was looking at until those annoying things went away when there was finally light in the scene.
 
-Watching a YouTube video, where there was a plain black background, no camera moving, just a background, and there were bullet points being placed onto the background as they were being explained, the annoying moving pixelated pacmans are jumping all over the place.
 
-So basically I now realize that the patches are present anytime there is black.
 
If it is a natural thing, could someone tell me the name of what is happening so I can further read about it. Thank you greatly!!
